column10: A group of business terms providing information on the business process and rules applicable to the Invoice document.

column2: Card 1..1 to be corrected on Xsd
column10: Identifies the business process context in which the transaction appears, to enable the Buyer to process the Invoice in an appropriate way.
column11: To be specifid by the Buyer.
column12: CHORUSPRO: this data makes it possible to inform the "cadre de facturation" (billing framework, which could be invoice from agent, co-contractor, subcontractor, invoicing part of a public works contract, etc.). The codes to be used are defined in the CHORUSPRO specifications: A1 (invoice deposit), A2 (prepaid invoice deposit), ... By default (in the absence of this field), the case A1 is applied.

column10: An identification of the specification containing the total set of rules regarding semantic content, cardinalities and business rules to which the data contained in the instance document conforms.
column11: This identifies compiance or conformance to this document. Conformant invoices specify: urn:cen.eu:en16931:2017. Invoices, compliant to a user specification may identify that user specification here. No identification scheme is to be used.
column12:
For profile Minimum : urn:factur-x.eu:1p0:minimum
For profile BASIC WL : urn:factur-x.eu:1p0:basicwl
For profile BASIC : urn:cen.eu:en16931:2017#compliant#urn:factur-x.eu:1p0:basic
For Profile EN 16931 (Comfort) : urn:cen.eu:en16931:2017
For Profile EXTENDED : urn:cen.eu:en16931:2017#conformant#urn:factur-x.eu:1p0:extended
column13: BR-1: An Invoice shall have a Specification identifier (BT-24).

column10: A unique identification of the Invoice.
column11: The sequential number required in Article 226(2) of the directive 2006/112/EC [2], to uniquely identify the Invoice within the business context, time-frame, operating systems and records of the Seller . It may be based on one or more series of numbers, which may include alphanumeric characters. No identification scheme is to be used.
column12: CHORUSPRO: the invoice number is limited to 20 characters
column13: BR-2: An Invoice shall have an Invoice number (BT-1).

column10: A code specifying the functional type of the Invoice.
column11:
Commercial invoices and credit notes are defined according the entries in UNTDID 1001 [6]. 
Other  entries of UNTDID 1001 [6] with specific invoices or credit notes may be used if applicable.
column12:
The types of documents used are:
380: Commercial Invoice
381: Credit note
384: Corrected invoice
389: Self-billied invoice (created by the buyer on behalf of the supplier)
261: Self billed credit note (not accepted by CHORUSPRO)
386: Prepayment invoice
751: Invoice information for accounting purposes (not accepted by CHORUSPRO)
column13: BR-4: An Invoice shall have an Invoice type code (BT-3).

column10: The date when the Invoice was issued.
The date when the Invoice was issued.
column12: CHORUSPRO: the issue date must be before or equal to the deposit date.
column13: BR-3: An Invoice shall have an Invoice issue date (BT-2).

column11: Only value "102"
column13: Only value "102"

column10: A group of business terms providing textual notes that are relevant for the invoice, together with an indication of the note subject.
A textual note that gives unstructured information that is relevant to the Invoice as a whole.
column11: Such as the reason for any correction or assignment note in case the invoice has been factored.

column10: The subject of the textual note in BT-22.
column11: To be chosen from the entries in UNTDID 4451 [6].
column12:
Among the list, the following codes can be used:
AAI: General Information
SUR: Supplier Notes
REG: Regulatory information
ABL: Legal Information
TXD: Tax Information
CUS: Customs Information

column10: A group of business terms providing information on individual Invoice lines.
column13: BR-16: An Invoice shall have at least one Invoice line (BG-25).

column10: A unique identifier for the individual line within the Invoice.
column13: BR-21: Each   Invoice   line   (BG-25)   shall   have   an   Invoice   line identifier (BT-126).

column10: Detailed information about the free text of the line item
A textual note that gives unstructured information that is relevant to the Invoice line.
A group of business terms providing information about the goods and services invoiced.
An item identifier based on a registered scheme.
column12: CHORUSPRO: this field is limited to 40 characters
column13: BR-64: The Item standard identifier (BT-157) shall have a Scheme identifier

column10: The identification scheme identifier of the Item standard identifier
column11: The identification scheme shall be identified from the entries of the list published by the ISO/IEC 6523 maintenance agency.

column10: An identifier, assigned by the Seller, for the item.
An identifier, assigned by the Buyer, for the item.
A name for an item.
column13: BR-25: Each Invoice line (BG-25) shall contain the Item name (BT- 153).

column10: A description for an item.
column11: The Item description allows for describing the item and its features in more detail than the Item name.

column10: A group of business terms providing information about properties of the goods and services invoiced.
The name of the attribute or property of the item.
column11: Such as "Colour".
column13: BR-54: Each Item attribute (BG-32) shall contain an Item attribute name (BT-160) and an Item attribute value (BT-161).

column10: The value of the attribute or property of the item.
column11: Such as "Red".
column13: BR-54: Each Item attribute (BG-32) shall contain an Item attribute name (BT-160) and an Item attribute value (BT-161).

column10: A code for classifying the item by its type or nature.
column11: Classification codes are used to allow grouping of similar items for a various purposes e.g. public procurement (CPV), e-Commerce (UNSPSC) etc.
column13: BR-65: The   Item   classification   identifier   (BT-158)   shall   have   a Scheme identifier

column10: The identification scheme identifier of the Item classification identifier
column11: The identification scheme shall be chosen from the entries in UNTDID 7143 [6].

column10: The version of the identification scheme.
The code identifying the country from which the item originates.
column11: The lists of valid countries are registered with the ISO 3166-1 Maintenance agency, "Codes for the representation of names of countries and their subdivisions".

column10: A group of business terms providing information about the price applied for the goods and services invoiced on the Invoice line.
An identifier for a referenced line within a purchase order, issued by the Buyer.
column11: The purchase order identifier is referenced on document level.

column10: Detailed information on the gross price of the item
The unit price, exclusive of VAT, before subtracting Item price discount.
column12: The Item gross price MUST NOT be negative
column13: BR-28: The Item gross price (BT-148) shall NOT be negative.

column10: The number of item units to which the price applies.
column12: To fill if BT-149 is present and if BT-148 is present, with the same value than BT-149

column9: Item price base quantity unit of measure code
column10: The unit of measure that applies to the Item price base quantity.
column11: The Item price base quantity unit of measure shall be the same as the Invoiced quantity unit of measure (BT-130).
column12:
In particular, the most common units of measurement are:
LTR = litre (1 dm3)
MTQ = cubic meter
KGM = kilogram
MTR = meter
C62 = unit
TNE = ton
column13: BT-130, BT-150 and BT-150-1 must be equal if stated.

column2: Allow Charges and Allowances on Gross price

column11: Price allowance => false
column13: Value = false

column10: The total discount subtracted from the Item gross price to calculate the Item net price.
column11: Only applies if the discount is provided per unit and if it is not included in the Item gross price.

column10: The price of an item, exclusive of VAT, after subtracting item price discount.
column11: The Item net price has to be equal with the Item gross price less the Item price discount.
column12: The Item net price MUST NOT be negative
column13:
BR-26: Each  Invoice  line  (BG-25)  shall  contain  the  Item  net  price (BT-146).

BR-27: The Item net price (BT-146) shall NOT be negative.

column10: The number of item units to which the price applies.
column12: Optional, if filled and if BT-148 is present (EN16931 and EXTENDED profiles), then it should be the same value than BT-149-1

column9: Item price base quantity unit of measure code
column10: The unit of measure that applies to the Item price base quantity.
column11: The Item price base quantity unit of measure shall be the same as the Invoiced quantity unit of measure (BT-130).
column12:
In particular, the most common units of measurement are:
LTR = litre (1 dm3)
MTQ = cubic meter
KGM = kilogram
MTR = meter
C62 = unit
TNE = ton
column13: BT-130, BT-150 and BT-150-1 must be equal if stated.

column10: The quantity of items (goods or services) that is charged in the Invoice line.
column12: CHORUS PRO: Invoiced quantity is supported on 10 digits maximum.
column13: BR-22: Each  Invoice  line  (BG-25)  shall  have  an  Invoiced  quantity (BT-129).

column10: The unit of measure that applies to the invoiced quantity.
column11: The unit of measure shall be chosen from the lists in UN/ECE Recommendation N°. 20 “Codes for Units of Measure Used in International Trade” [7] and UN/ECE Recommendation N° 21 “Codes for Passengers, Types of Cargo, Packages and Packaging Materials (with Complementary Codes for Package Names)” [19] applying the method described in UN/ECE Rec N° 20 Intro 2.a). Note that in most cases it is not needed for Buyers and Sellers to implement these lists fully in their software. Sellers need only to support the units needed for their goods and services; Buyers only need to verify that the units used in the Invoice are equal to the units used in other documents (such as Contract, Catalogue, Order and Despatch advice).
column12:
In particular, the most common units of measurement are:
LTR = litre (1 dm3)
MTQ = cubic meter
KGM = kilogram
MTR = meter
C62 = unit
TNE = ton
column13: BR-23: An Invoice line (BG-25) shall have an Invoiced quantity unit of measure code (BT-130).

column10: Grouping of billing information at line level
A group of business terms providing information about the VAT applicable for the goods and services invoiced on the Invoice line.

column9: Tax Type(Code)Invoiced item VAT category code, Content
column10: The VAT category code for the invoiced item.
column11: For more information on the recommended codes, please refer to subclause 6.3.3.2 - Specification of VAT category codes.Fixed value = "VAT"
column13: Fixed value "VAT"

column10: The VAT category code for the invoiced item.
column11:
The following entries of UNTDID 5305 [6] are used (further clarification between brackets):
- Standard rate (Liable for VAT in a standard way)
- Zero rated goods (Liable for VAT with a percentage rate of zero)
- Exempt from tax (VAT/IGIC/IPSI)
- VAT Reverse Charge (Reverse charge VAT/IGIC/IPSI rules apply)
- VAT exempt for intra community supply of goods (VAT/IGIC/IPSI not levied due to Intra-community supply rules)
- Free export item, tax not charged (VAT/IGIC/IPSI not levied due to export outside of the EU)
- Services outside scope of tax (Sale is not subject to VAT/IGIC/IPSI)
- Canary Islands General Indirect Tax (Liable for IGIC tax)
- Liable for IPSI (Ceuta/Melilla tax)
column12:
The VAT category codes are as follows:
S = Standard VAT rate
Z = Zero rated goods
E = VAT exempt
AE = Reverse charge
K = Intra-Community supply (specific reverse charge)
G = Exempt VAT for Export outside EU
O = Outside VAT scope
L = Canary Islands
M = Ceuta and Mellila
column13: BR-CO-4: Each  Invoice  line  (BG-25)  shall  be  categorized  with  an Invoiced item VAT category code (BT-151).

column10: The VAT rate, represented as percentage that applies to the invoiced item.
column12: The value to enter is the percentage. For example, for 20%, it must be given as 20 (and not 0.2)

column10: A group of business terms providing information about the Invoice period relevant for the Invoice line.
column11: Is also called Invoice line delivery period.

column10: The date when the Invoice period for this Invoice line starts.
column11: The date is the first day of the period.
column12: This date must be less than or equal to the end date of the period (BT-135), if it exists
column13: BR-CO-20: If  Invoice  line  period  (BG-26)  is  used,  the  Invoice  line period start date (BT-134) or the Invoice line period end date (BT-135) shall be filled, or both.

column11: Only value "102"
column13: Only value "102"

column10: The date when the Invoice period for this Invoice line ends.
column11: The date is the last day of the period.
column12: This date must be greater than or equal to the period start date (BT-134), if it exists
column13:
BR-30: If both Invoice line period start date (BT-134) and Invoice line  period  end  date  (BT-135)  are  given  then  the  Invoice line period end date (BT-135) shall be later or equal to the Invoice line period start date (BT-134).

BR-CO-20: If  Invoice  line  period  (BG-26)  is  used,  the  Invoice  line period start date (BT-134) or the Invoice line period end date (BT-135) shall be filled, or both.

column11: Only value "102"
column13: Only value "102"

column10: A group of business terms providing information about allowances applicable to the individual Invoice line.
column12: Invoice line allowancess are subject to the same VAT rate as the line they relate to. If invoice line allowances are subject to a different VAT rate, they must be treated as standalone (negative) invoice lines
column13: ChargeIndicator=false

column10: Indicator indicating whether the following data is for a charge or an allowance.

column11: Value = false
column13: Value = false

column10: The percentage that may be used, in conjunction with the Invoice line allowance base amount, to calculate the Invoice line allowance amount.
column12: The value to enter is the percentage. For example, for 20%, it must be given as 20 (and not 0.2)

column10: The base amount that may be used, in conjunction with the Invoice line allowance percentage, to calculate the Invoice line allowance amount.
The amount of an allowance, without VAT.
column13: BR-41: Each  Invoice  line  allowance  (BG-27)  shall  have  an  Invoice line allowance amount (BT-136).

column10: The reason for the Invoice line allowance, expressed as a code.
column11: Use entries of the UNTDID 5189 code list [6]. The Invoice line level allowance reason code and the Invoice line level allowance reason shall indicate the same allowance reason.
column12:
In particular, the following codes and reasons can be used:
AA = Advertising discount
ABL = Packing supplement
ADR = Other services
ADT = Removal
FC = transportation costs
FI = Financial expenses
LA = Labeling
column13:
BR-42: Each  Invoice  line  allowance  (BG-27)  shall  have  an  Invoice line allowance reason (BT-139) or an Invoice line allowance reason code (BT-140).

BR-CO-7: Invoice line allowance reason code (BT-140) and Invoice line  allowance  reason  (BT-139)  shall  indicate  the same type of allowance reason.

BR-CO-23: Each  Invoice  line  allowance  (BG-27)  shall  contain  an Invoice  line  allowance  reason  (BT-139)  or  an  Invoice line allowance reason code (BT-140), or both.

column10: The reason for the Invoice line allowance, expressed as text.
column13:
BR-42: Each  Invoice  line  allowance  (BG-27)  shall  have  an  Invoice line allowance reason (BT-139) or an Invoice line allowance reason code (BT-140).

BR-CO-7: Invoice line allowance reason code (BT-140) and Invoice line  allowance  reason  (BT-139)  shall  indicate  the same type of allowance reason.

BR-CO-23: Each  Invoice  line  allowance  (BG-27)  shall  contain  an Invoice  line  allowance  reason  (BT-139)  or  an  Invoice line allowance reason code (BT-140), or both.

column10: A group of business terms providing information about charges and taxes other than VAT applicable to the individual Invoice line.
column11: All charges and taxes are assumed to be liable to the same VAT rate as the Invoice line.
column12: Invoice line charges are subject to the same VAT rate as that of the line to which they relate. If invoice line charges are subject to a different VAT rate, they must be treated as stand-alone invoice lines.
column13: ChargeIndicator=true

column11: Value = true
column13: Value = true

column10: The percentage that may be used, in conjunction with the Invoice line charge base amount, to calculate the Invoice line charge amount.
column12: The value to enter is the percentage. For example, for 20%, it must be given as 20 (and not 0.2)

column10: The base amount that may be used, in conjunction with the Invoice line charge percentage, to calculate the Invoice line charge amount.
The amount of a charge, without VAT.
column13: BR-43: Each Invoice line charge (BG-28) shall have an Invoice line charge amount (BT-141).

column10: The reason for the Invoice line charge, expressed as a code.
column11: Use entries of the UNTDID 7161 code list [6]. The Invoice line charge reason code and the Invoice line charge reason shall indicate the same charge reason.
column12:
In particular, the following codes and reasons can be used:
AA = Advertising discount
ABL = Packing supplement
ADR = Other services
ADT = Removal
FC = transportation costs
FI = Financial expenses
LA = Labeling
column13:
BR-44: Each Invoice line charge (BG-28) shall have an Invoice line charge  reason  (BT-144)  or  an  Invoice  line  charge  reason code (BT-145).

BR-CO-8: Invoice  line  charge  reason  code  (BT-145)  and  Invoice line charge reason (BT144) shall indicate the same type of charge reason.

BR-CO-24: Each Invoice line charge (BG-28) shall contain an Invoice line  charge  reason  (BT-144)  or  an  Invoice  line  charge reason code (BT-145), or both.

column10: The reason for the Invoice line charge, expressed as text.
column13:
BR-44: Each Invoice line charge (BG-28) shall have an Invoice line charge  reason  (BT-144)  or  an  Invoice  line  charge  reason code (BT-145).

BR-CO-8: Invoice  line  charge  reason  code  (BT-145)  and  Invoice line charge reason (BT144) shall indicate the same type of charge reason.

BR-CO-24: Each Invoice line charge (BG-28) shall contain an Invoice line  charge  reason  (BT-144)  or  an  Invoice  line  charge reason code (BT-145), or both.

column10: Detailed information about item totals
The total amount of the Invoice line.
column11: The amount is “net” without VAT, i.e. inclusive of line level allowances and charges as well as other relevant taxes.
column13: BR-24: Each  Invoice  line  (BG-25)  shall  have  an  Invoice  line  net amount (BT-131).

column10: Object identifier at the invoice item level
An identifier for an object on which the invoice line is based, given by the Seller.
column11: It may be a subscription number, telephone number, meter point etc., as applicable.
Value = 130
column13: Use with TypeCode "130"

column9:
Scheme identifier
Invocice line object identifier
column10: The identification scheme identifier of the Invoice line object identifier.
column11:
If it may be not clear for the receiver what scheme is used for the identifier, a conditional scheme identifier should be used that shall be chosen from the UNTDID 1153 code list [6] entries.
TypeCode = "130" invoice data sheet

column10: Detailed information on the accounting reference
A textual value that specifies where to book the relevant data into the Buyer's financial accounts.
column11: If required, this reference shall be provided by the Buyer to the Seller prior to the issuing of the Invoice.

column10: An identifier assigned by the Buyer used for internal routing purposes.
column11: The identifier is defined by the Buyer (e.g. contact ID, department, office id, project code), but provided by the Seller in the Invoice.
column12: CHORUS PRO: for the public sector, it is the "Service Exécutant". It is mandatory for some buyers. It must belong to the Chorus Pro repository. It is limited to 100 characters.

column10: A group of business terms providing information about the Seller.
An identification of the Seller.
column11: For many systems, the Seller identifier is a key piece of information. Multiple Seller identifiers may be assigned or specified. They may be differentiated by using various identification schemes. If no scheme is specified, it should be known by Buyer and Seller, e.g. a previously exchanged Buyer assigned identifier of the Seller.
column13: BR-CO-26: In   order   for   the   buyer   to   automatically   identify   a supplier,  the  Seller  identifier  (BT-29),  the  Seller  legal registration  identifier  (BT-30)  and/or  the  Seller  VAT identifier (BT-31) shall be present.
column23: GloablID, if global identifier exists and can be stated in @schemeID, ID else

column10: An identification of the Seller.
column11: GloablID, if global identifier exists and can be stated in @schemeID, ID else
column12: If the seller has a GlobalID, he can qualify it with this attribute. Otherwise, he uses the ID.
column13: GloablID, if global identifier exists and can be stated in @schemeID, ID else
column23: GloablID, if global identifier exists and can be stated in @schemeID, ID else

column10: Scheme identifier
column11: The identification scheme identifier shall be chosen from the entries of the list published by the ISO 6523 maintenance agency.
column12:
In particular, the following codes can be used:
0021 : SWIFT
0060 : DUNS
0088 : GLN
0177 : ODETTE

column10: The full formal name by which the Seller is registered in the national registry of legal entities or as a Taxable person or otherwise trades as a person or persons.
column13: BR-6: An Invoice shall contain the Seller name (BT-27).

column10: Additional legal information relevant for the Seller.
column11: Such as share capital.

column10: Details about the organization
An identifier issued by an official registrar that identifies the Seller as a legal entity or person.
column11: If no identification scheme is specified, it must be known by Buyer and Seller.
column13: BR-CO-26: In   order   for   the   buyer   to   automatically   identify   a supplier,  the  Seller  identifier  (BT-29),  the  Seller  legal registration  identifier  (BT-30)  and/or  the  Seller  VAT identifier (BT-31) shall be present.

column10: The identification scheme identifier of the Seller legal registration identifier.
column11: If used, the identification scheme shall be chosen from the entries of the list published by the ISO/IEC 6523 maintenance agency.
column12: For a SIREN or a SIRET, the value of this field is "0002"

column10: A name by which the Seller is known, other than Seller name (also known as Business name).
column11: This may be used if different from the Seller name.
column12: CHORUS PRO: this field is limied to 99 characters.

column10: A group of business terms providing contact information about the Seller.
A contact point for a legal entity or person.
column11: Such as person name, contact identification, department or office identification.

column10: A contact point for a legal entity or person.
column11: Such as person name, contact identification, department or office identification : Department Name

column10: Detailed information about the seller phone number
A phone number for the contact point.
Detailed information about the seller email address
An e-mail address for the contact point.
A group of business terms providing information about the address of the Seller.
column11: Sufficient components of the address are to be filled in order to comply to legal requirements.
column12: Like any address, the fields necessary to define the address must appear. The country code is mandatory.
column13: BR-8: An Invoice shall contain the Seller postal address (BG-5).

column10: The identifier for an addressable group of properties according to the relevant postal service.
column11: Such as a ZIP code or a post code.

column10: The main address line in an address.
column11: Usually the street name and number or post office box.

column10: An additional address line in an address that can be used to give further details supplementing the main line.
An additional address line in an address that can be used to give further details supplementing the main line.
The common name of the city, town or village, where the Seller address is located.
A code that identifies the country.
column11: If no tax representative is specified, this is the country where VAT is liable. The lists of valid countries are registered with the ISO 3166-1 Maintenance agency, "Codes for the representation of names of countries and their subdivisions".
column13: BR-9: The   Seller   postal   address   (BG-5)   shall   contain   a   Seller country code (BT-40).

column10: The subdivision of a country.
column11: Such as a region, a county, a state, a province, etc.

column10: Details about the electronic address
Identifies the Seller's electronic address to which a business document may be delivered.
column13: BR-62: The Seller  electronic  address  (BT-34)  shall  have  a Scheme identifier.

column10: The identification scheme identifier of the Seller electronic address
column11: The scheme identifier shall be chosen from a list to be maintained by the Connecting Europe Facility.

column10: Detailed information on tax information of the seller
The Seller's VAT identifier (also known as Seller VAT identification number).
column11: VAT number prefixed by a country code. A VAT registered Supplier shall include his VAT ID, except when he uses a tax representative.
column13:
BR-CO-9: The    Seller    VAT    identifier    (BT-31),    the    Seller    tax representative  VAT  identifier  (BT-63)  and  the  Buyer VAT identifier (BT-48) shall have a prefix in accordance with ISO code ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 by which the country of issue may be identified. Nevertheless, Greece may use the prefix ‘EL’.

BR-CO-26: In   order   for   the   buyer   to   automatically   identify   a supplier,  the  Seller  identifier  (BT-29),  the  Seller  legal registration  identifier  (BT-30)  and/or  the  Seller  VAT identifier (BT-31) shall be present.

column10: The local identification (defined by the Seller’s address) of the Seller for tax purposes or a reference that enables the Seller to state his registered tax status.
column11: This information may affect how the Buyer settles the payment (such as for social security fees). E.g. in some countries, if the Seller is not registered as a tax paying entity then the Buyer is required to withhold the amount of the tax and pay it on behalf of the Seller.

column10: Scheme identifier for supplier fiscal identifier
column11: Value = FC

It is recommended not to use contacting details for the purpose of routing the received Invoice internally by the recipient; the Buyer reference identifier should be used for this purpose.

column10: A group of business terms providing information about additional supporting documents substantiating the claims made in the Invoice.
column11: The additional supporting documents can be used for both referencing a document number which is expected to be known by the receiver, an external document (referenced by a URL) or as an embedded document (such as a time report in pdf). The option to link to an external document will be needed, for example in the case of large attachments and/or when sensitive information, e.g. person-related services, has to be separated from the Invoice itself.
column12: CHORUS PRO: If the group "ADDITIONAL SUPPORTING DOCUMENTS" is filled in, one of the following two business terms must be present: Attached Document (BT-125) or External document location (URI) (BT-124)

column11:
A means of locating the resource including its primary access mechanism, e.g. http://
or ftp://.
External document location shall be used if the Buyer requires additional information to support the Invoice.
External documents do not form part of the invoice. Risks can be involved when accessing external documents.
The code  916 "Additional supporting documents" shall be used to refer to the identification of additional supporting  documents (BT-122).

A group of business terms to specify a direct debit.
column11: This group may be used to give prior notice in the invoice that payment will be made through a SEPA or other direct debit initiated by the Seller, in accordance with the rules of the SEPA or other direct debit scheme.
column12: CHORUS PRO : not used

column10: Unique banking reference identifier of the Payee or Seller assigned by the Payee or Seller bank.
column11: Used in order to pre-notify the Buyer of a SEPA direct debit.
column12: This is the ICS for SEPA direct debits

column10: A textual value used to establish a link between the payment and the Invoice, issued by the Seller.
column11:
Used for creditor's critical reconciliation information. This information element helps the Seller to assign an incoming payment to the relevant payment process. When specifying the textual value, which is commonly the invoice number of the invoice being paid, but may be another seller reference, the buyer should indicate this reference in his payment order when executing the payment. In a payment transaction this reference is transferred back to the Seller as Remittance Information.

In order to allow for automatic processing of cross-border SEPA payments, only Latin characters should be used in this field, with a maximum of 140 characters. Referencesection 1.4 of the SEPA credit transfer and SEPA direct debit scheme implementation guides [13] and [14] for details of the allowed characters. Other rules may apply for SEPA payments within national borders.

If remittance information is structured according to the ISO 11649:2009 standard [16] for Structured RF Creditor Reference, it shall be mapped to the Structured Remittance Information Creditor Reference field in SEPA payments messages.
If remittance information is structured according to the EACT standard for automated reconciliation [17], it shall be mapped to the Unstructured Remittance Information field in SEPA payments messages.”

If remittance information is to be mapped to the End To End Identification field or to the Structured Remittance Information Creditor Reference field in SEPA payments messages, then in addition to the Latin character set restriction, the content shall not start or end with a '/' and the content shall not contain '//'s. See reference [15].

column10: The currency used for VAT accounting and reporting purposes as accepted or required in the country of the Seller.
column11:
Shall be used in combination with the Total VAT amount in accounting currency (BT-111) when the VAT accounting currency code differs from the Invoice currency code.
The lists of valid currencies are registered with the ISO 4217 Maintenance Agency "Codes for the representation of currencies and funds". Please refer to Article 230 of the Council Directive 2006/112/EC [2] for more information.

column10: The currency in which all Invoice amounts are given, except for the Total VAT amount in accounting currency.
column11:
Only one currency shall be used in the Invoice, except for the Total VAT amount in accounting currency (BT-111) in accordance with article 230 of Directive 2006/112/EC on VAT.
The lists of valid currencies are registered with the ISO 4217 Maintenance Agency "Codes for the representation of currencies and funds".
column12: CHORUS PRO: Invoices and credit notes or Chorus Pro are mono-currencies only.
column13: BR-5: An Invoice shall have an Invoice currency code (BT-5).

column10: A group of business terms providing information about the Payee, i.e. the role that receives the payment.
column11: The role of Payee may be fulfilled by another party then the Seller, e.g. a factoring service.
column12:
This group makes it possible to identify the invoices to be paid to a third-party Payee in the case of factoring.
CHORUS PRO: In the event of subrogation factoring, the legal information associated with subrogation must be present in the PDF visual presentation of the invoice.
In this case, the bank identifier oresent in the invoice is the Factor one.

column10: An identifier for the Payee.

column3: Card 0..n for multiple bank account (EN16931, BASIC, BASIC WL)
column10: A group of business terms providing information about the payment.
The means, expressed as code, for how a payment is expected to be or has been settled.
column11:
Entries from the UNTDID 4461 code list [6] shall be used. Distinction should be made
between SEPA and non-SEPA payments, and between credit payments, direct debits, card payments and other instruments.
column12:
In particular, the following codes can be used:
10: Species
20: Check
30: Transfer (includes SEPA transfer for CHORUSPRO)
42: Payment on bank account
48: Payment by credit card
49: Direct debit (includes SEPA Direct Debit for CHORUSPRO)
57 : Standing Agreement
58: SEPA transfer (not used for CHORUSPRO: code 30)
59: SEPA Direct Debit (not used for CHORUSPRO: code 49)
97: Report
ZZZ: agreed amoung trading partners on interim basis
column13: BR-49: A  Payment  instruction  (BG-16)  shall  specify  the  Payment means type code (BT-81).

column10: The means, expressed as text, for how a payment is expected to be or has been settled.
column11: Such as cash, credit transfer, direct debit, credit card, etc.

column10: A group of business terms providing information about card used for payment contemporaneous with invoice issuance.
column11: Only used if the Buyer has opted to pay by using a payment card such as a credit or debit card.

column10: The Primary Account Number (PAN) of the card used for payment.
column11: In accordance with card payments security standards an invoice should never include a full card primary account number. At the moment PCI Security Standards Council has defined following: The first 6 digits and last 4 digits are the maximum number of digits to be shown.
column13: BR-51: The last 4 to 6 digits of the Payment card primary account number    (BT-87)    shall    be    present    if    Payment    card information (BG-18) is provided in the Invoice.

column10: The name of the payment card holder.
Buyer bank information

Use IBANID if applicable, ProprietaryID else

column10: A group of business terms providing information about VAT breakdown by different categories, rates and exemption reasons
column13: BR-CO-18: An Invoice shall at least have one VAT breakdown group (BG-23).

column10: The total VAT amount for a given VAT category.
column11: Calculated by multiplying the VAT category taxable amount with the VAT category rate for the relevant VAT category.
column13:
BR-46: Each VAT breakdown (BG-23) shall have a VAT category tax amount (BT-117).

BR-CO-17: VAT   category   tax   amount   (BT-117)   =   VAT   category taxable amount (BT-116) x (VAT category rate (BT-119) / 100), rounded to two decimals.

column9: Type of tax (code)VAT category code, Content
column10: Coded identification of a VAT category.
column11: The VAT category code and the VAT category rate shall be consistent. For more information on the recommended codes, please refer to subclause 6.3.3.2 - Specification of VAT category codes.Fix value = "VAT"
column13: Fixed value "VAT"

column10: A textual statement of the reason why the amount is exempted from VAT or why no VAT is being charged
column11: Articles 226 items 11 to 15 Directive 2006/112/EC [2].
column12: CHORUS PRO: this field is limited to 1024 characters

column10: Sum of all taxable amounts subject to a specific VAT category code and VAT category rate (if the VAT category rate is applicable).
column11: The sum of Invoice line net amount minus allowances plus charges on document level which are subject to a specific VAT category code and VAT category rate (if the VAT category rate is applicable).
column13: BR-45: Each  VAT  breakdown  (BG-23)  shall  have  a  VAT  category taxable amount (BT-116).

column10: Coded identification of a VAT category.
column11:
The following entries of UNTDID 5305 [6] are used (further clarification between brackets):
- Standard rate (Liable for VAT in a standard way)
- Zero rated goods (Liable for VAT with a percentage rate of zero)
- Exempt from tax (VAT/IGIC/IPSI)
- VAT Reverse Charge (Reverse charge VAT/IGIC/IPSI rules apply)
- VAT exempt for intra community supply of goods (VAT/IGIC/IPSI not levied due to Intra-community supply rules)
- Free export item, tax not charged (VAT/IGIC/IPSI not levied due to export outside of the EU)
- Services outside scope of tax (Sale is not subject to VAT/IGIC/IPSI)
- Canary Islands General Indirect Tax (Liable for IGIC tax)
- Liable for IPSI (Ceuta/Melilla tax)
column12:
The VAT category codes are as follows:
S = Standard VAT rate
Z = Zero rated goods
E = VAT exempt
AE = Reverse charge
K = Intra-Community supply (specific reverse charge)
G = Exempt VAT for Export outside EU
O = Outside VAT scope
L = Canary Islands
M = Ceuta and Mellila
column13:
BR-47: Each  VAT  breakdown  (BG-23)  shall  be  defined  through  a VAT category code (BT-118).

For EXTENDED profile only, BR-O-11, BR-O-12, BR-O-13 and BR-O-14 are not applied.

column10: A coded statement of the reason for why the amount is exempted from VAT.
column11: Code list issued and maintained by the Connecting Europe Facility.

column10: Tax due date
column11: This does not apply in Germany. Use date of delivery instead.

column10: The date when the VAT becomes accountable for the Seller and for the Buyer in so far as that date can be determined and differs from the date of issue of the invoice, according to the VAT directive.
column11:
The tax point is usually the date goods were supplied or services completed (the 'basic tax point'). There are some variations. Please refer to Article 226 (7) of the Council Directive 2006/112/EC [2] for more information.
This element is required if the Value added tax point date is different from the Invoice issue date. 
Both Buyer and Seller should use the Tax Point Date when provided by the Seller. The use of BT-7 and BT-8 is mutually exclusive.
column12: This date shall not be present if the Value added tax point date is expressed in code in the "Value added tax point date code" (BT-8)
column13: BR-CO-3: Value added tax point date (BT-7) and Value added tax point date code (BT-8) are mutually exclusive.

column11: Only value "102"
column13: Only value "102"

column9: Value added tax point date code
column10: The code of the date when the VAT becomes accountable for the Seller and for the Buyer.
column11:
The code shall distinguish between the following entries of UNTDID 2005 [6]:
- Invoice docment issue date
- Delivery date, actual
- Payment date. The Value added tax point date code is used if the Value added tax point date is not known when the invoice is issued. The use of BT-8 and BT-7 is mutually exclusive.
column12:
This code can not be present if the Value added tax point date is provided directly in the "Value added tax point date" (BT-7). 
This code should be selected from the following values from UNTDID 2475 (instead of UNTDID 2005 [6]):
5: Date of the invoice (VAT on DEBITS)
29: Delivery date (VAT on DEBITS)
72: Payment date (VAT on RECEIPTS)
column13: BR-CO-3: Value added tax point date (BT-7) and Value added tax point date code (BT-8) are mutually exclusive.

column13: BR-48: Each  VAT  breakdown  (BG-23)  shall  have  a  VAT  category rate (BT-119), except if the Invoice is not subject to VAT.

BR-CO-19: If Invoicing period (BG-14) is used, the Invoicing period start date (BT-73) or the Invoicing period end date (BT-74) shall be filled, or both.

column11: Use entries of the UNTDID 5189 code list [6]. The Document level allowance reason code and the Document level allowance reason shall indicate the same allowance reason.
column13:
BR-33: Each   Document   level   allowance   (BG-20)   shall   have   a Document  level  allowance  reason  (BT-97)  or  a  Document level allowance reason code (BT-98).

BR-CO-5: Document   level   allowance   reason   code   (BT-98)   and Document level allowance reason (BT-97) shall indicate the same type of allowance.

BR-CO-21: Each Document level allowance (BG-20) shall contain a Document    level    allowance    reason    (BT-97)    or    a Document level allowance reason code (BT-98), or both.

column10: The reason for the document level allowance, expressed as text.
column12: CHORUS PRO: this field is limited to 1024 characters
column13:
BR-33: Each   Document   level   allowance   (BG-20)   shall   have   a Document  level  allowance  reason  (BT-97)  or  a  Document level allowance reason code (BT-98).

BR-CO-5: Document   level   allowance   reason   code   (BT-98)   and Document level allowance reason (BT-97) shall indicate the same type of allowance.

BR-CO-21: Each Document level allowance (BG-20) shall contain a Document    level    allowance    reason    (BT-97)    or    a Document level allowance reason code (BT-98), or both.

column9: VAT type code for document level allowances
column11: Value = VAT
column13: Fixed value "VAT"

column9: Document level allowance VAT category code
column10: A coded identification of what VAT category applies to the document level allowance.
column11:
The following entries of UNTDID 5305 [6] are used (further clarification between brackets):
- Standard rate (Liable for VAT in a standard way)
- Zero rated goods (Liable for VAT with a percentage rate of zero)
- Exempt from tax (VAT/IGIC/IPSI)
- VAT Reverse Charge (Reverse charge VAT/IGIC/IPSI rules apply)
- VAT exempt for intra community supply of goods (VAT/IGIC/IPSI not levied due to Intra-community supply rules)
- Free export item, tax not charged (VAT/IGIC/IPSI not levied due to export outside of the EU)
- Services outside scope of tax (Sale is not subject to VAT/IGIC/IPSI)
- Canary Islands General Indirect Tax (Liable for IGIC tax)
- Liable for IPSI (Ceuta/Melilla tax)
column12:
The VAT category codes are as follows:
S = Standard VAT rate
Z = Zero rated goods
E = VAT exempt
AE = Reverse charge
K = Intra-Community supply (specific reverse charge)
G = Exempt VAT for Export outside EU
O = Outside VAT scope
L = Canary Islands
M = Ceuta and Mellila
column13: BR-32: Each   Document   level   allowance   (BG-20)   shall   have   a Document level allowance VAT category code (BT-95).

column10: The VAT rate, represented as percentage that applies to the document level allowance.
column12: The value to enter is the percentage. For example, for 20%, it must be given as 20 (and not 0.2)

column10: A group of business terms providing information about charges and taxes other than VAT, applicable to the Invoice as a whole.
column13: ChargeIndicator=true

column9: Charges and Allowances Document level Indicator

column11: Value = true
column13: Value = true

column10: The percentage that may be used, in conjunction with the document level charge base amount, to calculate the document level charge amount.
column12: The value to enter is the percentage. For example, for 20%, it must be filled 20 (and not 0.2)

column10: The base amount that may be used, in conjunction with the document level charge percentage, to calculate the document level charge amount.
The amount of a charge, without VAT.
column13: BR-36: Each Document level charge (BG-21) shall have a Document level charge amount (BT-99).

column10: The reason for the document level charge, expressed as a code.
column11: Use entries of the UNTDID 7161 code list [6]. The Document level charge reason code and the Document level charge reason shall indicate the same charge reason.
column12:
In particular, the following codes and reasons can be used:
AA = Advertising discount
ABL = Packing supplement
ADR = Other services
ADT = Removal
FC = transportation costs
FI = Financial expenses
LA = Labeling
column13:
BR-38: Each Document level charge (BG-21) shall have a Document level  charge  reason  (BT-104)  or  a  Document  level  charge reason code (BT-105).

BR-CO-6: Document   level   charge   reason   code   (BT-105)   and Document  level  charge  reason  (BT-104)  shall  indicate the same type of charge.

BR-CO-22: Each  Document  level  charge  (BG-21)  shall  contain  a Document level charge reason (BT-104) or a Document level charge reason code (BT-105), or both.

column10: The reason for the document level charge, expressed as text.
column12: CHORUS PRO: this field is limited to 1024 characters
column13:
BR-38: Each Document level charge (BG-21) shall have a Document level  charge  reason  (BT-104)  or  a  Document  level  charge reason code (BT-105).

BR-CO-6: Document   level   charge   reason   code   (BT-105)   and Document  level  charge  reason  (BT-104)  shall  indicate the same type of charge.

BR-CO-22: Each  Document  level  charge  (BG-21)  shall  contain  a Document level charge reason (BT-104) or a Document level charge reason code (BT-105), or both.

column9: VAT type code for document level charges
column11: Value = VAT
column13: Fixed value "VAT"

column9: Document level charge VAT category code
column10: A coded identification of what VAT category applies to the document level charge.
column11:
The following entries of UNTDID 5305 [6] are used (further clarification between brackets):
- Standard rate (Liable for VAT in a standard way)
- Zero rated goods (Liable for VAT with a percentage rate of zero)
- Exempt from tax (VAT/IGIC/IPSI)
- VAT Reverse Charge (Reverse charge VAT/IGIC/IPSI rules apply)
- VAT exempt for intra community supply of goods (VAT/IGIC/IPSI not levied due to Intra-community supply rules)
- Free export item, tax not charged (VAT/IGIC/IPSI not levied due to export outside of the EU)
- Services outside scope of tax (Sale is not subject to VAT/IGIC/IPSI)
- Canary Islands General Indirect Tax (Liable for IGIC tax)
- Liable for IPSI (Ceuta/Melilla tax)
column12:
The VAT category codes are as follows:
S = Standard VAT rate
Z = Zero rated goods
E = VAT exempt
AE = Reverse charge
K = Intra-Community supply (specific reverse charge)
G = Exempt VAT for Export outside EU
O = Outside VAT scope
L = Canary Islands
M = Ceuta and Mellila
column13: BR-37: Each Document level charge (BG-21) shall have a Document level charge VAT category code (BT-102).

column10: The VAT rate, represented as percentage that applies to the document level charge.
column12: The value to enter is the percentage. For example, for 20%, it must be given as 20 (and not 0.2)

column10: A textual description of the payment terms that apply to the amount due for payment (Including description of possible penalties).
column11: This element may contain multiple lines and multiple terms.
column13: BR-CO-25: In   case   the   Amount   due   for   payment   (BT-115)   is positive,  either  the  Payment  due  date  (BT-9)  or  the Payment terms (BT-20) shall be present.

column10: The date when the payment is due.
column11: The payment due date reflects the due date of the net payment. For partial payments it states the first net due date. The corresponding description of more complex payment terms can be stated in BT-20 Payment terms.
column13: BR-CO-25: In   case   the   Amount   due   for   payment   (BT-115)   is positive,  either  the  Payment  due  date  (BT-9)  or  the Payment terms (BT-20) shall be present.

column11: Only value "102"
column13: Only value "102"

column10: Unique identifier assigned by the Payee for referencing the direct debit mandate.
column11: Used in order to pre-notify the Buyer of a SEPA direct debit.
column12: This is the RUM (Unique Mandate Reference) for SEPA direct debits

column10: A group of business terms providing the monetary totals for the Invoice.
column12:
CHORUS PRO: Amounts in an invoice are expressed by a figure on 19 positions.
They can not have more than two decimals. The separator is ". "

column9: Sum of Invoice line net amount
column10: Sum of all Invoice line net amounts in the Invoice.
column13:
BR-12: An  Invoice  shall  have  the  Sum  of  Invoice  line  net  amount (BT-106).

BR-CO-10: Sum  of  Invoice  line  net  amount  (BT-106)  =  ∑  Invoice line net amount (BT-131).

For EXTENDED profile only, BR-CO-10 is replaced by BR-FXEXT-CO-10, which add a tolerance of 0,01 euro per line, document level charge and allowance in calculation.

column9: Sum of charges on document level
column10: Sum of all charges on document level in the Invoice.
column11: Charges on line level are included in the Invoice line net amount which is summed up into the Sum of Invoice line net amount.
column13:
BR-CO-12: Sum   of   charges   on   document   level   (BT-108)   =   ∑ Document level charge amount (BT-99).

For EXTENDED profile only, BR-CO-12 is replaced by BR-FXEXT-CO-12, which add a tolerance of 0,01 euro per line, document level charge and allowance in calculation.

column9: Sum of allowances on document level
column10: Sum of all allowances on document level in the Invoice.
column11: Allowances on line level are included in the Invoice line net amount which is summed up into the Sum of Invoice line net amount.
column13:
BR-CO-11: Sum  of  allowances  on  document  level  (BT-107)  =  ∑ Document level allowance amount (BT-92).

For EXTENDED profile only, BR-CO-11 is replaced by BR-FXEXT-CO-11, which add a tolerance of 0,01 euro per line, document level charge and allowance in calculation.

column10: The total amount of the Invoice without VAT.
column11: The Invoice total amount without VAT is the Sum of Invoice line net amount minus Sum of allowances on document level plus Sum of charges on document level.
column13:
BR-13: An Invoice shall have the Invoice total amount without VAT (BT-109).

BR-CO-13: Invoice total amount without VAT (BT-109) = ∑ Invoice line   net   amount   (BT-131)   -   Sum   of   allowances   on document level (BT-107) + Sum of charges on document level (BT-108).

column10: The total VAT amount for the Invoice.
column11: The Invoice total VAT amount is the sum of all VAT category tax amounts.
column13: BR-CO-14: Invoice  total  VAT  amount  (BT-110)  =  ∑  VAT  category tax amount (BT-117).
column23: @currencyID is mandatory to differentiate between VAT amount and VAT amount in accounting currency.

column13: @currencyID is mandatory to differentiate between VAT amount and VAT amount in accounting currency.
column23: @currencyID is mandatory to differentiate between VAT amount and VAT amount in accounting currency.

column9: Invoice total VAT amount in accounting currency
column10: The VAT total amount expressed in the accounting currency accepted or required in the country of the Seller.
column11: To be used when the VAT accounting currency (BT-6) differs from the Invoice currency code (BT-5) in accordance with article 230 of Directive 2006/112 / EC on VAT. The VAT amount in accounting currency is not used in the calculation of the Invoice totals.
column13: BR-53: If the VAT accounting currency code (BT-6) is present, then the  Invoice  total  VAT  amount  in  accounting  currency  (BT-111) shall be provided.
column23: @currencyID is mandatory to differentiate between VAT amount and VAT amount in accounting currency.

column13: @currencyID is mandatory to differentiate between VAT amount and VAT amount in accounting currency.
column23: @currencyID is mandatory to differentiate between VAT amount and VAT amount in accounting currency.

column10: The amount to be added to the invoice total to round the amount to be paid.
column12: This case is not applied in France.

column10: The total amount of the Invoice with VAT.
column11: The Invoice total amount with VAT is the Invoice total amount without VAT plus the Invoice total VAT amount.
column13:
BR-14: An  Invoice  shall  have  the  Invoice  total  amount  with  VAT (BT-112).

BR-CO-15: Invoice total amount with VAT (BT-112) = Invoice total amount   without   VAT   (BT-109)   +   Invoice   total   VAT amount (BT-110).

For EXTENDED profile only, BR-CO-15 is replaced by BR-FXEXT-CO-15, which add a tolerance of 0,01 euro per line, document level charge and allowance in calculation.

column10: The sum of amounts which have been paid in advance.
column11: This amount is subtracted from the invoice total amount with VAT to calculate the amount due for payment.

column10: The outstanding amount that is requested to be paid.
column11: This amount is the Invoice total amount with VAT minus the paid amount that has been paid in advance. The amount is zero in case of a fully paid Invoice. The amount may be negative; in that case the Seller owes the amount to the Buyer.
column13:
BR-15: An  Invoice  shall  have  the  Amount  due  for  payment  (BT- 115).

BR-CO-16: Amount   due   for   payment   (BT-115)   =   Invoice   total amount  with  VAT  (BT-112)  -Paid  amount  (BT-113)  + Rounding amount (BT-114).

column10: A group of business terms providing information on one or more preceding Invoices.
column11:
To be used in case: 
- a preceding invoice is corrected 
- preceding partial invoices are refered to from a final invoice 
- preceding pre-payment invoices are refered to from a final invoice
column12: This business group is mandatory in case of a Credit Note in order to reference the invoices it credits, unless the Credit Note refers to a period which must then be present in group BG-14.

column10: The identification of an Invoice that was previously sent by the Seller.
column13: BR-55: Each  Preceding  Invoice  reference  (BG-3)  shall  contain  a Preceding Invoice reference (BT-25).

column10: The date when the Preceding Invoice was issued.
column11: The Preceding Invoice issue date shall be provided in case the Preceding Invoice identifier is not unique.
Only value "102"
column13: Only value "102"

column10: A textual value that specifies where to book the relevant data into the Buyer's financial accounts.
column12: CHORUS PRO: not used
